visualization_prompt: Generate a heatmap showing value distribution across a 5x5 grid using synthetic data with linear progression and strategic null placement
visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a 5x5 matrix (25 cells) with two variable types: categorical coordinates (X/Y positions) and continuous/null values. Synthetic values follow an arithmetic sequence (0-24) with μ=12 and σ=7.2, while 28% null cells follow a diagonal pattern, creating intentional data gaps. The heatmap effectively encodes three dimensions through positional axes and color gradients while maintaining Cairo's perceptual topology through ordered hues. Null labeling uses Tufte's data-ink maximization by only displaying context-specific annotations where values are missing. The triangular distribution (visible in value clustering at higher coordinates) and systematic null placement demonstrate controlled synthetic data generation.
